s.text: Although the V80E mutant self-associates weakly under the high pH conditions used for crystallization, we were able to show that the native interface is quite strong.

In particular, a protein with a mutation in the EH surface (V80E) could bind with high affinity (K d = 2 nM) to a protein with a mutation in the ML surface (A61D) to form a heterodimer with a native interface.

In particular, a protein with a mutation in the EH surface (V80E) could bind with high affinity (K d = 2 nM) to a protein with a mutation in the ML surface (A61D) to form a heterodimer with a native interface.

The data was processed with DENZO/SCALEPACK [ 23 ] . The molecular replacement solution was found using AMORE [ 20 ] with a previously solved TEL-SAM mutant (V80E) dimer structure as the search model.
